bunpro.meaning: To the extent that, So…that, About the only thing that...
bunpro.meaning_warning: くらい and ぐらい may be used 100% interchangeably, but ぐらい is far more common in speech
bunpro.writeup: Often, thenounくらいis used as anadverbial particle. This use ofくらい(or ぐらい) expresses the limit of something, in a similar way to ほど. This means that it can be translated as 'about (A)', 'so (A) that (B)', or '(A) to the extent of (B)'. Let's take a look at a few examples.Despite translating in the above ways, we can see that this use ofくらいis similar to the standard kanji use位, which literally means a 'rank', or 'grade' of something. What this means is that (A) will usually be considered to be at the 'grade' of something that was required in order to cause/allow (B).

examples.japanese: 今日はもう一生走りたくないくらい走った。
examples.english: Today, I ran so much that I don't want to run again in my whole life.

examples.japanese: わたしも叫びたいくらい、怖かった。
examples.english: I was so scared that I wanted to scream too.

examples.japanese: 5連休が必要なぐらい疲れています。
examples.english: I am tired to the extent that it is necessary for me to have 5 days off.

examples.japanese: 俺もキヨミさんくらいピアノが弾けるようになりたい。
examples.english: I want to be able to play the piano to about the level of Kiyomi-san.

examples.japanese: 寝るしかしたくないくらい、疲れている。
examples.english: I am so tired that I don't want to do anything but sleep.

examples.japanese: プロ選手ぐらい上手になりたい。
examples.english: I want to be skilled to the extent that pro athletes are.

examples.japanese: 少し日本語を話せるぐらい勉強したことがある。
examples.english: I have studied to the extent that I can speak a little Japanese.

examples.japanese: 兄は久し振りにアメリカから帰った。兄だとわからないくらい変わってしまった。
examples.english: My brother returned home for the first time in a long time from America. He changed, to the extent that I didn't recognize that it was him.

examples.japanese: みんなを泣かすくらいスパイシーなチリのサラダを作った。
examples.english: I made a chili salad so spicy that it made everyone cry.

false_friends.meaning: Even, To even, To the extent of
The more, About, To the extent that, So much… that

dojg.description: A particle which is used to express the degree of a state.
dojg.meaning: To the extent that; so ~ that ~ (almost) ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~

examples.japanese: (ksa).私達は一歩も歩けないくらい疲れていた。
examples.english: We  were so tired that we couldn't even take a step. (literally: We were tired to  the extent that we couldn't even walk one step.)

examples.japanese: (ksb).今晩は暖かいのでストーブが要らないくらいだ。
examples.english: It  is so warm this evening that we (almost) don't need a heater.

examples.japanese: (ksc).山田さんくらいよく物を忘れる人はいない。
examples.english: There's  no one who is as forgetful as Yamada (literally: who forgets things as much as  Yamada does).

examples.japanese: (ksd).私は料理は下手ですが、ご飯くらい(は)炊けます。
examples.english: I  am a poor cook (literally: bad at cooking), but I can at least cook rice.

examples.japanese: (kse).今この仕事が出来るのは彼くらいのものだ。
examples.english: He  is the only person who can do this job now. (literally: The person who is  capable enough to do this job is he.)

examples.japanese: (ksf).そんなことをするくらいなら死んだ方がましだ。
examples.english: I  would rather die than do such a thing.

examples.japanese: (a).その家は直しようがないくらい傷んでいた。
examples.english: That  house was so damaged that it couldn't be repaired. (literally: That house was  damaged to the extent that it couldn't be repaired.)

examples.japanese: (b).次郎はひどく酔っていて立っていられないくらいだった。
examples.english: Jiro  was so drunk that he couldn't hold himself upright.

examples.japanese: (c).こんな本、十ドルでもまだ高いくらいだ。
examples.english: Even  ten dollars would still be too expensive for a book like this.

examples.japanese: (d).内田さんくらいかわいそうな人はいない。
examples.english: This  is no one who is as pitiful as Uchida.

examples.japanese: (e).あの時くらい苦しかった時はない。
examples.english: I  have never suffered as much as I did that time.

examples.japanese: (f).信頼していた人に裏切られる(こと)くらい辛いことはない。
examples.english: There  is nothing as painful as being betrayed by someone you have trusted.

examples.japanese: (g).いくら安い所でもシャワーくらい付いているでしょう。
examples.english: Even  though it is a cheap place, there should at least be a shower.

examples.japanese: (h).そんな物に二万円も出すのはあなたくらいのものですよ。
examples.english: You  are the only person who would pay as much as 20,000 yen for such a thing.

examples.japanese: (i).あんな男の下で働くくらいなら乞食になった方がましだ。
examples.english: I  would rather be a beggar than work under such a man.
